content: in this legal case the tallinn district court made a decision ruling that one party is responsible for covering the procedural costs but the exact amount is not specified the case lasted for two years the court decision referred to as court dec involves the republic of estonia the court refused to accept additional evidence provided by f and explained the progress of the case involving two parties the harju county court partially annulled a previous decision and made a new one the decision states that the claimants request to divide the estate through a public auction was dismissed joint ownership of the estate and apartment property was terminated with one party becoming the sole owner of each property financial compensation was awarded to the other party for the loss of ownership the court also ordered the parties to enter into property rights agreements and make corresponding entries in the land register the decision was partially upheld on appeal and the appealing party was responsible for the costs of the proceedings both parties have the option to submit a cassation appeal to the supreme court within 30 days the district court found errors in the county courts application of the law and made a new decision to terminate joint assets and distribute them between the parties the decision was partially appealed by both parties the district court considered the interests of the parties and determined that one party should become the sole owner of the property and pay compensation to the other party the market value of the property was determined by expert opinions the court concluded that the defendant must compensate the claimant a certain amount and terminate the coownership the court also mentioned relevant sections of the law regarding property rights agreements and the execution of the decision the claimant must provide a statement of intent to transfer ownership and pay fair compensation to the defendant the court resolved the dispute between the parties in their interests and the allocation of procedural costs will be determined by the court both parties will bear the financially determinable costs of the proceedings
